Hand Hygiene Best Practice Guide

<Page Title Auto Text>

Simple tasks can contaminate hands

 

  • Taking a patient's vital signs
  • Touching the patient's clothing or linens
  • Touching equipment and furniture nearby

 

Specific Indications for Hand Hygiene

  • Before
  • Patient contact
  • Donning gloves for procedures such as insertion of central lines, urinary catheters, peripheral IVs
  • After
  • Contact with a patient's skin
  • Contact with body fluids or excretions, non-intact skin, wound dressings
  • Removing gloves
